channel.title: Comments on: How to set Internet Explorer 8 View Source Tool/Editor

item.title: By: Nick
item.dc:creator: Nick
item.description: Very helpful, this one actually works. I searched a few times a while back and couldn't find a solution that worked.
item.content:encoded: Very helpful, this one actually works. I searched a few times a while back and couldn’t find a solution that worked.

item.title: By: GatoCat
item.dc:creator: GatoCat
item.description: Thanks for how to change the editor.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for how to change the editor.

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/741/comment-page-1#comment-2340">Stephen Streufert</a>.
That one exists on Vista as well -- but I found that it had no impact on Vista when trying to reset it back to the default view.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Stephen Streufert.

That one exists on Vista as well — but I found that it had no impact on Vista when trying to reset it back to the default view.

item.title: By: Stephen Streufert
item.dc:creator: Stephen Streufert
item.description:
Thanks for the tip; you pointed me in the right direction. However, on my XP Pro system, the Registry key is:
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\View Source Editor\Editor Name
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the tip; you pointed me in the right direction. However, on my XP Pro system, the Registry key is:

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\View Source Editor\Editor Name
